meanings.definition: The text of an opera or other long vocal work.
meanings.sent1: The libretto of the opera was beautifully written and brought the story to life.
meanings.sent2: She studied the libretto carefully before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The libretto of the opera was so funny that it made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His words danced on the libretto like musical notes on a staff.
meanings.sent5: The libretto painted a vivid picture of the characters' emotions.

meanings.definition: A book containing the text of a musical work.
meanings.sent1: I found the libretto of the musical at the bookstore.
meanings.sent2: The libretto included all the lyrics and stage directions.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy libretto around felt like lugging a dictionary.
meanings.sent4: The libretto was a treasure trove of musical inspiration.
meanings.sent5: She cherished the libretto as if it held the secrets of the universe.
